column4: It means the package you've build hasn't created that file, so ld can't do anything with it. Maybe you need to check the build-dependencies of the source and install any additional requried libraries and development headers
did you see my comment?
Read my previous comment!

It means the package you've build hasn't created that file, so ld can't do anything with it. Maybe you need to check the build-dependencies of the source and install any additional requried libraries and development headers
It sounds as if the configure script expects otherwise :)
if it doesn't what would you suggest I need?
You'd have to examine the configure script to see what it checks for. As dennisWang said earlier, try "./configure --help"

http://wiki.awn-project.org/InstallingFromSource#AWN_From_Source That is the source that is leading me on this install. Per what I have found from what I've looked at and read Ubuntu 8.04 LTS has the latest compents required.
Are you building on Hardy?
Dependencies: There are a number of header/library packages needed to compile/install Awn - the headers are likely what you have to sort out
Did you get the source from the bazaar VCS, or use the tar-ball ?
Did you check that you have all the dependencies installed? They do provide a handy table: http://wiki.awn-project.org/Dependency_Matrix

any idea if I can just make a applet for the trash can manually? I'm feeling this isn't going to be worth while to compile this tonight. If I can't work around this I will likely continue compiling tomorrow.
The best way to do that is copy the source of one of the simple applets in gnome-applets and adjust it to suit
link me?

How about trying this. Change to a clean fresh directory. Do "sudo apt-get install bzr". when that is done, do "bzr co lp:awn awn", then do "cd awn". then do "sudo apt-get build-dep avant-window-navigator", then build it using "fakeroot debian/rules binary"
before doing that maybe tell me how to copy a trash can applet command so i can just manually add it to AWN?
I have no idea what you mean by "a trash can applet command"

In AWN i can manually add a launcher or an applet. The trash can is simply an applet. If I can browse to where the applet actually exist, I can manually add it to AWN. The other alternative is running a command. If you tell me how to open the gui trashcan at cmd then I can add it manually to AWN that way.
I'm not sure where the trash applet lives
If you can add applets by their ID, it is "OAFIID:GNOME_Panel_TrashApplet"
